title: Print, "Snap the Whip, from Harper's Weekly, September 20, 1873, pp. 245-25", 1873
medium: Wood engraving on off-white wove paper
signed:
Signed on block, lower right: HOMER 1873
Signed on block, lower left: LAGARDE Sc
inscribed: Caption: "SNAP-THE-WHIP."- DRAWN BY WINSLOW HOMER.- [SEE PAGE 826.]
creditline: Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.
description: Nine barefoot country boys play snap the whip.  Seven boys are holding onto each other's hands while two boys have broken away on the left.  On the right middle ground is a school house.  On the left, children can be seen in the background.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Snap the Whip, from Harper's Weekly, September 20, 1873, pp. 245-25", 1873.
1873. Wood engraving on off-white wove paper. Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.. 1947-4-60.
